section.h2: Top played tracks from the last month

section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Comedy, Fantasy, Drama, Romance

div.div:
Two realms exist in the ancient land of Yanato: the Lofty Realm, where gods reside, and the Lowly Realm, where humans reside. Princess Sakuna was the daughter of the god of war and goddess of harvest, but she led a lazy life. One day, she is banished to Hinoe Island, the Isle of Demons. Stranded in a barren land, Sakuna sets out to slay demons and farm rice. Her new adventure begins!
(Source: Crunchyroll)

The second season of Mairimashita! Iruma-kun. Suzuki Iruma, human and deeply non-aggressive, one day becomes the grandson of the great demon Sullivan. Doted on beyond belief, Iruma starts school where "Grandpa" serves as the chair... and finds, to his surprise, that he enjoys life there with Asmodeus, Clara, and the rest of his demon classmates. But just when Iruma thought he'd fitted in, there's more trouble ahead! A ring begins to talk, and Iruma... goes bad?! Iruma's chaotic, demonic life at school continues! (Source: NHK)
Youkoso Jitsuryoku Shijou Shugi no Kyoushitsu e: Other School Days

Welcome to the Classroom of the Supreme Ability Doctrine: Other School Days is an official spin-off anthology manga of You-Zitsu series, which was published under Media Factory's MF Comic imprint on September 23, 2017.

After a disastrous defeat at the 2018 World Cup, Japan's team struggles to regroup. But what's missing? An absolute Ace Striker, who can guide them to the win. The Japan Football Union is hell-bent on creating a striker who hungers for goals and thirsts for victory, and who can be the decisive instrument in turning around a losing match...and to do so, they've gathered 300 of Japan's best and brightest youth players. Who will emerge to lead the team...and will they be able to out-muscle and out-ego everyone who stands in their way? (Source: Kodansha USA) Note: Winner of the 45th Kodansha Manga Award in the Shounen Category in 2021.
How do you use Aeron MDS with multiple publishers and a single subscriber where the publishers are unaware of the subscriber machine IPs?

I am trying to use Aeron Multi-Destination-Subscriptions where I have multiple publishers publish messages to their own IP address and port. I want a subscriber to subscribe to each of the publishers IP addresses and PORTs on the same stream ID. The publishers and subscribers are on separate machines. For simplicity, I'm testing this with a single Publisher and Subscriber setup. I am using docker to create a virtual network so I can designate the IPs of the publisher and subscriber machines. Here is my example code: Publication code final String publicationChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (3 more lines were trimmed) Subscription code final String subscriptionChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (8 more lines were trimmed) I have a doWork in both of these which repeatedly call subscription.isConnected() and publication.isConnected(). I expected this to work just like the MDC example where you can use control-mode=manual on the publication side and call publication.addDestination(subscriberIP:port) where the subscription would be setup to subscribe to its own subscriberIP:port. In testing, the publication and subscription are not connected. This test class in the aeron repo uses MDS over UDP using localhost and using multicast addresses MDSTest so I thought the same would hold true for using the publisher machines IP and port. Would really appreciate if someone could explain why this doesn't work?
